file_content.text: Thanks again. Got a lot of food for thought.
Look at this city. And the Voss--they're so serene. Imagine being able to trust every word your leaders say.
It's been a while since I had that kind of faith in people. Working... behind the scenes, does that to you.
Recognizing that is a step forward. Maybe visiting Voss will be good for you.
It's never too late to change.
I hope so. It's been a real eye-opener so far.
Blind faith is as dangerous as paranoia. There's nothing wrong with being cautious.
Trust needs to be earned.
Paranoia's kept me alive, but that's not the same as really living.
This war's taking its toll on everyone.
We're all making sacrifices.
I know, infantry has it worst. But at least your battles are out in the light.
Not trusting politicians, fair enough. But if you can't trust anyone, where does that leave you?
You must believe in something.
I don't know. Even having to ask is depressing.
You mean, you're an SIS agent.
You mean, you're an SIS agent.
You're very forthcoming.
Heh, sorry. Looks like the Voss are having an effect on me.
I've spent years trying to help the Republic win. Did a lot of things I'd rather forget. Then I see the Voss.
Secret ops, political ploys... they don't exist for the Voss. They don't need them. And I keep wondering if I still do. Maybe it's time to walk away.
You should consider it.
It's a big decision. But, Voss strikes me as a good place for a fresh start.
The work you do protects people like the Voss. This kind of peace wouldn't be possible without you.
But you save innocent lives.
True. I suppose the Voss would say, everything has to balance out.
You took on the responsibility of keeping people safe. You can't abandon that because of a moment of weakness.
Don't be selfish.
You don't pull any punches, do you? Hah. But that doesn't make you wrong.
I'll think about it. Sorry, I didn't mean to drop all this on you.
Thanks for listening. Here--I've had this since my first solo mission. Maybe it'll bring you luck.
It's so peaceful here compared to Coruscant; you can hear yourself think.
